channel.title: overloadX client, can someone help me?
channel.description:
im using overloadX's client, and my own source i made from a blank pi, but im having some trouble with the client, i get some nullpointer errors but thats an easy fix, but i jarred the client to make sure everything was good for when im finished with it and i get these errors: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY DOUBLE-CLICK THE "helios.jar" TO RUN IT - Generated by: JAR Maker ([url=http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/]http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/[/url])
C:\Users\hemphill-jonathan\Desktop>java -jar helios.jar java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\cache\main_file_cache.dat (The system cannot fi nd the path specified) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java:42) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\cache\main_file_cache.dat (The system cannot fi nd the path specified) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java:42) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) File could not be found. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ the files are there in the cache, so i dont know why im getting this. the cache is in the client folder not the C:\ i looked around in signlink.java and didnt see anything wrong. if someone can help me with this that would be great, thanks in advance

item.title: overloadX client, can someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“CoderOops, post:2, topic:539727”]you cant make .jar file out of cache.

You need to make it autodownload it and put in your C:/ and only .jar class files.[/quote]
No buddy, he doesn’t need to make it autodownload, that’s bs. He can make it load at the directory where the client is. I’ve did this too, had a jar file including my cache located in the same directory and it loaded with no problems.

But in this case, check if the path to the cache is right / the cache is right zipped.

Read full topic
item.source: overloadX client, can someone help me?

item.title: overloadX client, can someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

you cant make .jar file out of cache.

You need to make it autodownload it and put in your C:/ and only .jar class files.

Read full topic

item.title: overloadX client, can someone help me?
item.dc:creator: @trisidia17 trisidia17
item.description:
@trisidia17 wrote:

im using overloadX’s client, and my own source i made from a blank pi, but im having some trouble with the client, i get some nullpointer errors but thats an easy fix, but i jarred the client to make sure everything was good for when im finished with it and i get these errors:

THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY
DOUBLE-CLICK THE "helios.jar" TO RUN IT
-
Generated by: JAR Maker ([url=http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/]http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/[/url])

C:\Users\hemphill-jonathan\Desktop>java -jar helios.jar
java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\cache\main_file_cache.dat (The system cannot fi
nd the path specified)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java:42)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
java.io.FileNotFoundException: .\cache\main_file_cache.dat (The system cannot fi
nd the path specified)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.open(Native Method)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at java.io.RandomAccessFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
        at sign.signlink.run(signlink.java:42)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
File could not be found.

the files are there in the cache, so i dont know why im getting this.
the cache is in the client folder not the C:
i looked around in signlink.java and didnt see anything wrong.
if someone can help me with this that would be great, thanks in advance
